snippet: Manufacturing gains were concentrated in developing countries, with China reporting its best month in nearly two years.
abstract: Floyd Norris Off The Charts column investigates figures that may indicate an approaching end to the worldwide manufacturing slowdown that began in 2012.
lead_paragraph: Manufacturing gains were concentrated in developing countries, with China reporting its best month in nearly two years.

headline.print_headline: Factories Are Firing Up, Except in Europe
headline.seo: Global Manufacturing Edges Up, Except in Europe
headline.main: Factories Are Firing Up, Except in Europe
